verbose_text: Studies have demonstrated that the acute augmentation of O-GlcNAc levels improves the tolerance to stress stimuli, confers cardioprotective effects against ischemia-reperfusion (IR) injury, blunts the cardiomyocyte nuclear factor of activated T-cells (NFAT)-induced changes during hypertrophy and attenuates vascular inflammation.
evidence: O-GlcNAc levels improves the tolerance to stress stimuli              , confers cardioprotective effects against ischemia-reperfusion (IR) injury              , blunts the cardiomyocyte nuclear factor of activated T-cells (NFAT)-induced changes during hypertrophy               and attenuates vascular inflammation
